GapFillInput.Title: Describing behaviour
GapFillInput.Instruction: Can you work out the anagrams in brackets? Type your answers into the gaps.

Content.Question:
1. Pierre wasn’t known for his tasty cooking, and last night his friends very truthfully told him that the meal
he’d cooked was revolting. (ingltover)
2. In old films it was considered gentlemanly (lnyamlentge) behaviour to lay your jacket over a puddle for ladies to cross the road.
3. The comedian was quite funny, but many people in the audience took offence at his sexist (tsiexs) jokes.
4. It’s unhygienic (hyuniegicn) to start a meal without washing your hands.
5. A firm handshake and a genuine smile usually create a good first impression. (ionsesrpmi)
6. Jay’s reaction to his daughter’s new boyfriend was completely over the top (opt).
7. It might be considered too familiar (amfilira) to touch people you don’t know well when they’re talking to you.
8. It’s very good manners (srenanm) not to interrupt someone when they’re speaking to you.
9. Most employers do not consider it acceptable (cceaptbale) for employees regularly to be late to work or talk to friends on the phone.
10. It’s unprofessional (nalssoifeoprun) to turn up to a business presentation unprepared and looking untidy.
